content: This is so true. When I left my job as a journalist to become a teacher, I figured my writing would suffer. I was able to write four to five hours most days as a reporter. I now log about an hour each day. But my experiences as a teacher breathe life into my stories. I no longer take the time I have to write for granted. I also spend much more time in the idea phase of the craft, which has kept me from staring at a blank screen once I sit down to create a story. I feel less pressure now. Having another skill truly is beneficial.
